title: What is the pentatonic scale of all major scales? - Quora

response.answer_text: The pentatonic scale is the major scale that has the FOURTH and SEVENTH missing. (In Indian classical music fourth is referred to as Ma, and the seventh as Ni. My teacher always tells me it’s the scale without any MoNey) Example: G major scale: G A B C D E F# GHence G Pentatonic (Major) Scale: G A B D E G Formula: Root, Major 2nd, Major 3rd, Perefect 5, Major 6th, Octaveor: Sa, Re, Ga, Pa, Dha, Sa(higher)

The pentatonic scale is 5 note scale based on the normal scale and consisting of degrees 1 2 3 5 6 with 1 being the root note it can be based on minor or major scales, so simply start on any root note of your choosing and add 2 3 5 and 6 and you have your scales.
